column4: what is the command to fullscreen mplayer ? -fs merely fullscreens the window, not the video output
Oh, and it's the same with -fs -fstype fullscreen
what is the command to fullscreen mplayer ? -fs merely fullscreens the window, not the video output. Can it even be done? I
've installed w32codecs and everything seems to be in working order, except that I can only run mplayer via the terminal
actually the reason for 'not being able to do the simpel tasks'
is because you were taught bad bad bad habits on windows
thats because default totem is totem-gstreamer
the reason you cannot is because you are now running a true multiuser system with proper security setup, or rather at least it is assumed that you must not run as 'admin'
heh, i haveto occasionally run totem from cli when playing dvds with weird encryption issues so i can kill it safely too
I'd use totem - but it does not seem to have registred my downloaded/installed codecs
also switch to totem-xine and install w32codecs ... if totem has an issue you can always run vlc or vice versa
no need to compile mplayer, follow the totem xine instructions, you can finish it in like 3 minutes
remember, you are learning a whole new os, don't expect to learn something like that in 2 days what took 15 years with the other guys
hehe, thank you. I've always had windows on my stationary computer, but then last year I got a macintosh and ended up really fed up with windows
